intro: Derris matthewii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Derris matthewii is also known for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant floral display.
